text: I would imagine that, if configured via an environment variable (e.g. `JULIA_PAGER=less`), the built-in help would start that as a subprocess and feed the help output to that subprocess's stdin which would then paginate it to the terminal.  This could be really helpful because some pagers will (can optionally) restore the previous contents of the terminal so you can still see the past few REPL command lines after reminding yourself how a particular method with long help works.
